Emerging Mathematical Ideas

Develop algorithms for adding and subtracting rational numbers, such as:

  • When the numbers are either both positive or both negativeâ€”add the numbers and give the sum the same sign as the numbers added.
  • To add two positive numbers, add the numbers and make the number in the sum positive
  • To add two negatives, add the two numbers and make the number in the sum negative
  • To add a positive and negative number find the difference between the two numbers and the sign on the number for the sum is the same as the sign of the number with the largest absolute value (or said-- as the sign of the number that is further from 0).
  • Make sense of the relationship between addition and subtraction and how subtraction is the opposite operation of addition
  • To subtract two positive numbers, find the difference between the two numbers and:
  1. find the difference between the numbers or how far apart the numbers are on a number line
  2. a larger number minus a smaller number equals a positive difference
  3. a smaller number minus a larger number equals a negative difference

Mathematical Reflection

What do you know about rational numbers and their operations?
